prompt: <description>**CAD Model Description** The final CAD model is a 3D model of a cylindrical object with a rectangular protrusion on top. The protrusion is slightly larger than the diameter of the cylindrical object. The object is symmetrical along its central axis. **Part 1** Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The prism has a flat base and a slightly curved side. The prism's dimensions are approximately 2:3:4. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.2067, 0.375, 0.0] Draw the following 2D sketch: - Sketch a rectangle on Face 1 of the coordinate system. - Divide the rectangle into three sections by adding two lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0308, 0.0]; End Point [0.3058, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.3365, 0.0308]; End Point [0.3365, 0.1683] - Add arcs to the sketch to create curved corners. Three arcs are required: - Arc 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0308]; Mid Point [0.009, 0.009]; End Point [0.0308, 0.0] - Arc 2: Start Point [0.3058, 0.0]; Mid Point [0.3275, 0.009]; End Point [0.3365, 0.0308] - Arc 3: Start Point [0.3365, 0.1683]; Mid Point [0.1683, 0.3365]; End Point [0.0, 0.1683] Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.3365. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by rotating it around the Z-axis by -90.0 degrees and translating it along the X-axis to the position (0.2067, 0.375, 0.0). Extrude the 2D sketch to the depth of 0.375, resulting in a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with an approximate height of 0.3365, width of 0.375, and length of 0.3365. **Part 2** Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The object has a reflective surface and appears to be made of a shiny material. It is symmetrical along its vertical axis. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.375, 0.2067, 0.0] Draw the following 2D sketch: - Sketch a rectangle on Face 1 of the coordinate system. - Divide the rectangle into three sections by adding two lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0308, 0.0]; End Point [0.3058, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.3365, 0.0308]; End Point [0.3365, 0.1683] - Add arcs to the sketch to create curved corners.
